name: Infoblox Threat Defense with DDI
description: This app integrates with Infoblox Threat Defense with DDI to provide DNS Security, Threat Intelligence, and Centralized DDI (DNS, DHCP, and IP Address Management) capabilities. It enables automated lookups of IP and host asset data, and management of custom lists for security policies.

base_url.description: Base URL for Infoblox API (e.g., https://csp.infoblox.com)

ingestion_type.description: Type of data to retrieve and ingest

queried_name.description: Filter by comma-separated queried domain names (DNS Security Events)

policy_name.description: Filter by comma-separated security policy names (DNS Security Events)

threat_level.description: Filter by threat severity level (DNS Security Events)

threat_class.description: Filter by comma-separated threat class (DNS Security Events)

threat_family.description: Filter by comma-separated threat family (DNS Security Events)

threat_indicator.description: Filter by comma-separated threat indicators (domains, IPs) (DNS Security Events)

policy_action.description: Filter by comma-separated action performed (Log, Block, Default, Redirect) (DNS Security Events)

feed_name.description: Filter by comma-separated threat feed or custom list name (DNS Security Events)

network.description: Filter by comma-separated network name, on-premises host, endpoint, or DFP name (DNS Security Events)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of events to fetch (default: 100) (DNS Security Events)

max_hours_backwards.description: Specify the number of hours of historical data to retrieve for manual polling (default: 24 hours) (DNS Security Events)

soc_status.description: Filter by SOC Insight status (Infoblox SOC Insight)

soc_threat_type.description: Filter by SOC Insight threat type detected (Infoblox SOC Insight)

soc_priority.description: Filter by SOC Insight priority level (Infoblox SOC Insight)

actions.description: Ingest data from Infoblox (DNS Security Events or SOC Insights based on configuration)
Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Initiate an indicator investigation using Infoblox Dossier

indicator_type.description: Specify the type of indicator to search for

indicator_value.description: Specify the indicator value(s) based on the indicator type you want to search for

source.description: Specify the comma-separated sources to query

wait_for_results.description: If set to true, the call will wait for results to complete else return the jobID

example_values: Google Search is a fully-automated search engine.
Global list of known malicious domains for all sites.
Google Search is a fully-automated search engine.
Indicators associated with phishing campaign targeting Miles & More
The hottest months are here - is your car overheating?

actions.description: Retrieve the result of a previously initiated Dossier lookup for an indicator (IP/URL/Host/MAC/Hash)

job_id.description: Specify the Job ID of the Dossier lookup job to retrieve the results for

example_values: THis is a sample email with a comment
THis is a sample email with a comment

actions.description: Look up asset data for a given IP address using IPAM address information

ip_filter.description: Filter IP addresses by specific criteria (e.g., address=="192.168.1.100" or state=="USED")

scope.description: Specify the scope for IP address lookup

tag_filter.description: Filter IP addresses by specific tags (e.g. 'Tenable_scan'=='true')

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination (default: 0)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return (default: 100)

order_by.description: Comma-separated JSON fields to sort the results. Use asc or desc for sorting direction. Defaults to ascending. Supports dot notation for nested fields (e.g. json_field_name asc|desc)

actions.description: Retrieve Custom Lists from Infoblox by ID, name, or filtering criteria

custom_list_id.description: Specify the ID of the custom list to retrieve

name.description: The name of the custom list (name filtering can be only used in pairing with type)

type.description: The type of the custom list

tag_filter.description: Filter custom lists by specific tags (e.g: Test1=ss1)

tag_sort_order.description: Sort custom list by Tags (e.g: Test1)

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Delete a Custom List from Infoblox Cloud

id.description: ID of the custom List to delete

actions.description: Create a Network List with specified name, items, and optional description

name.description: Specify the name of the network list

items.description: Specify the comma-separated items to include in the network list (e.g. 193.56.2.11/32,2001:db8:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:fff1/128)

description.description: Specify a description for the network list

actions.description: Update metadata and CIDRs of a specified network list

network_list_id.description: Specify the ID of the network list to update

name.description: Specify the name of the network list

items.description: Specify the comma-separated items to include in the network list (e.g. 193.56.2.11/32,2001:db8:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:fff1/128)

description.description: Specify a description for the network list (use 'empty' to clear the description)

actions.description: Retrieve network lists and their metadata

network_list_id.description: Specify the ID of a specific network list to retrieve. If provided, all other filter parameters will be ignored

filter.description: Filter network lists by a logical expression string (e.g., name == 'net_list1'). Ignored if network_list_id is provided

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve the list of associated assets for a given Insight ID

insight_id.description: ID of the insight to retrieve assets from

os_version.description: Filter assets by operating system version

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

from.description: Filter by assets changed after this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

to.description: Filter by assets changed before this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

actions.description: Remove a specific network list by ID

network_list_id.description: Specify the ID of the network list to delete

actions.description: Look up host asset data using IPAM host information to retrieve detailed host information from Infoblox

host_filter.description: Filter IPAM hosts by specific criteria (e.g., name=="webserver01" or ip_address=="192.168.1.100")

tag_filter.description: Filter IPAM hosts by specific tags (e.g. 'Tenable_scan'=='true')

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination (default: 0)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return (default: 100)

order_by.description: Comma-separated JSON fields to sort the results. Use asc or desc for sorting direction. Defaults to ascending. Supports dot notation for nested fields (e.g. json_field_name asc|desc)

actions.description: Perform a DNS record query to retrieve associated IPs or domains from Infoblox DDI

dns_record_filter.description: Filter DNS records by specific criteria (e.g., type=="PTR" and absolute_zone_name == "Test")

tag_filter.description: Filter DNS records by specific tags (e.g., 'nios/federation_enabled'==true)

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination (default: 0)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return (default: 100)

order_by.description: Comma-separated JSON fields to sort the results. Use asc or desc for sorting direction. Defaults to ascending. Supports dot notation for nested fields (e.g. json_field_name asc|desc)

actions.description: Perform a DHCP lease query to retrieve lease information from Infoblox DDI

dhcp_lease_filter.description: Filter DHCP leases by specific criteria (e.g., address == "127.0.0.1" and hostname == "ubuntu")

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination (default: 0)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return (default: 100)

order_by.description: Comma-separated JSON fields to sort the results. Use asc or desc for sorting direction. Defaults to ascending. Supports dot notation for nested fields (e.g. json_field_name asc|desc)

actions.description: Lookup threat intelligence details for an indicator using Infoblox TIDE

indicator_type.description: Specify the type of indicator to search for

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (1-10000)

indicator_value.description: Specify the indicator value based on the indicator type you want to search for

domain.description: Specify the domain(s) to search for

tld.description: Specify the top-level domain(s) to search for

class.description: Specify the comma-separated threat class(es) to search for

expiration.description: Period of time after which data is no longer considered active (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ)

actions.description: Create a new custom list with specified details and items
actions.verbose: This action creates a new custom list in Infoblox Cloud using the Advanced Threat Control and Firewall (ATCFW) API. You can specify the list name, type, items (IPv4/IPv6 addresses or domain names), description, confidence level, threat level, and tags. The action validates input parameters and handles duplicate name errors appropriately.

name.description: Specify the name of the custom list to create

type.description: Specify the type of custom list to create

items.description: Specify comma-separated items to include in the custom list (e.g. 193.56.2.11/32,2001:db8:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:fff1/128)

description.description: Specify description of the custom list

confidence_level.description: Specify the confidence level for the custom list

threat_level.description: Specify the threat level for the custom list

tags.description: Add tags to categorize and organize the custom list in JSON format. Example: {"environment":"production","team":"security"}

actions.description: Update metadata of an existing custom list such as name, description, confidence level, threat level, or tags
actions.verbose: This action updates an existing custom list in Infoblox Threat Defense with DDI using the Advanced Threat Control and Firewall (ATCFW) API. You can update the list name, description, confidence level, threat level, and tags. Names must be unique among custom lists belonging to the same account.

custom_list_id.description: Specify the ID of the custom list to update

name.description: Specify the new name of the custom list (must be unique)

description.description: Specify the new description of the custom list

confidence_level.description: Specify the confidence level for the custom list

threat_level.description: Specify the threat level for the custom list

tags.description: Add tags to categorize and organize the custom list (JSON format). Use 'empty' to clear existing tags

example_values: Updated description for the custom list
Updated security blocklist for malicious domains

actions.description: Remove a specific Security Policy by Security Policy ID
actions.verbose: This action permanently removes a security policy from Infoblox Cloud using the Advanced Threat Control and Firewall (ATCFW) API. The security policy will be deleted from the system and can no longer be used to enforce security rules. This action cannot be undone.

security_policy_id.description: Specify the ID of the security policy to delete

example_values: Successfully removed security policy with ID: 12345

actions.description: Retrieve Security Policies and their metadata
actions.verbose: This action retrieves Security Policies and their metadata from Infoblox Cloud using the Advanced Threat Control and Firewall (ATCFW) API. You can filter policies by name, description, tags, and other criteria.

security_policy_filter.description: A logical expression string to filter security policies (e.g., name=='sec_policy_a')

tag_filter.description: Filter security policy by specific tags

tag_sort_filter.description: Sort security policy list by Tags

offset.description: Specify the offset from where to start pagination

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return

example_values: Suspicious destinations: Enables protection against hostnames

actions.description: Create a Security Policy, including its name, rules, associated network lists, DNS Forwarding Proxies (DFPs) etc
actions.verbose: This action creates a new Security Policy in Infoblox Cloud using the Advanced Threat Control and Firewall (ATCFW) API. The policy can include rules, network lists, DNS Forwarding Proxies, roaming device groups, and various configuration settings. The Security Policy name must be unique within the account.

name.description: Specify the name of the security policy to create

description.description: Specify description for this security policy

rules.description: Specify security rules as a list of JSON objects, each with action, type, data, policy_name and redirect_name

network_lists.description: Specify the comma-separated network lists to associate with this policy (e.g 522436, 522438)

dfps.description: Specify the comma-separated DNS Forwarding Proxies to associate with this policy (e.g 12456, 12458)

roaming_device_groups.description: Specify the comma-separated Roaming Device Groups to associate with this policy (e.g 56312, 56316)

block_dns_rebind_attack.description: Specify whether to block DNS rebinding attacks (true/false)

safe_search.description: Specify whether to enable safe search filtering (true/false)

tags.description: Add tags used to categorize and organize the Security Policy

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to update (precedence, access_codes, doh_enabled, doh_fqdn, ecs, onprem_resolve, dfp_services, net_address_dfps, user_groups, default_redirect_name)

example_values: Suspicious destinations: Enables protection against hostnames that have not been directly linked to malicious behavior but behave in a manner that suggests malicious behavior may be imminent.

actions.description: Insert or remove individual items (e.g., IPs, domains) in a custom list
actions.verbose: This action allows you to insert or remove individual items from a custom list without replacing the entire list. You can add new items or remove existing items by specifying the action type and providing a comma-separated list of items. Duplicate items will be silently skipped during insertion operations.

custom_list_id.description: Specify the ID of the custom list to update

action.description: Insert or Delete custom List items

items.description: Specify comma-separated IPs and domains to add or remove from the custom list (e.g. 193.56.2.11/32,2001:db8:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:fff1/128)

actions.description: Update a specific Security Policy, including its name, rules, associated network lists, DNS Forwarding Proxies (DFPs) etc

security_policy_id.description: Specify the ID of the security policy to update

name.description: Specify the name of the security policy to update

description.description: Specify an updated description for this security policy

rules.description: Specify updated security rules as a list of JSON objects, each with action, type, data, policy_name and redirect_name

network_lists.description: Specify the comma-separated network lists to associate with this policy (e.g 522436, 522438)

dfps.description: Specify the comma-separated DNS Forwarding Proxies to associate with this policy (e.g 12456, 12458)

roaming_device_groups.description: Specify the comma-separated Roaming Device Groups to associate with this policy (e.g 56312, 56316)

block_dns_rebind_attack.description: Specify whether to block DNS rebinding attacks (true/false)

safe_search.description: Specify whether to enable safe search filtering (true/false)

tags.description: Update tags used to categorize and organize the Security Policy

additional_parameters.description: JSON object containing additional parameters to update (precedence, access_codes, doh_enabled, doh_fqdn, ecs, onprem_resolve, dfp_services, net_address_dfps, user_groups, default_redirect_name)

example_values: Suspicious destinations: Enables protection against hostnames

actions.description: Retrieve the list of comments associated with a specific Insight ID from Infoblox, optionally filtered by a time range

insight_id.description: ID of the insight to retrieve comments from

from.description: Filter by comments changed after this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

to.description: Filter by comments changed before this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

actions.description: Retrieve a filtered list of indicators associated with a specific Insight ID from Infoblox, supporting multiple filter parameters

insight_id.description: ID of the insight to retrieve indicators from

from.description: Filter by indicators seen after this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

to.description: Filter by indicators seen before this time in this format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return (default: 100)

actions.description: Retrieve a detailed list of threat-related events for a specific Insight ID from Infoblox SOC Insights

insight_id.description: ID of the insight to retrieve events from

query_type.description: Filter events by DNS query type (e.g., TXT, A, MX)

source.description: Filter events by the threat intelligence source or feed (e.g., DFP (DFP))

indicator.description: Filter events by a specific threat indicator such as a domain, IP, or hash (e.g., hmdns.top)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return

from.description: Filter by events detected after this time in format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS

to.description: Filter by events detected before this time in format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS
